article_title: 6 Ways IP Has Been Used To Attack Critics
article_text:
6 Ways IP Has Been Used To Attack Critics

Law360, New York (June 3, 2015, 10:06 PM ET) -- It's fair to say Inglewood resident Joseph Teixeira isn't a fan of the city's mayor, James Butts. To date, he's posted six scathing videos on YouTube about Butts, with inflammatory titles like “James Butts exploits the murder of Fredrick Martin” and “Mayor James Butts Lies About Being a Hypocrite."



But is it fair to say he's a copyright infringer? That's what the city is claiming in a lawsuit it filed back in March: That Teixeira violated the copyrights the city holds in the public-access footage of...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: The city of Inglewood, California, is using questionable copyright claims to go after one of its most vocal opponents. Whether the city has a valid gripe or is merely trying to silence criticism, it's hardly the only plaintiff in recent years to use intellectual property to try to swat a gadfly.

og.title: 6 Ways IP Has Been Used To Attack Critics - Law360
